To find the number of coins $\maroonD{\text{Polly}}$ has, we start with the number of coins $\goldE{\text{Ron}}$ has and subtract $\blueE{3}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4ba046a62d098cdfa1b2dd25206d1d27fd68bb93)

$\goldE{6} - \blueE{3} = \maroonD{\Box}$

Let's subtract to find how many coins $\maroonD{\text{Polly}}$ has.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/56547e2aa788966fee5400a53f4a30d35863442c)

$\goldE{6} - \blueE{3} = \maroonD{3}$

question.content:
The king gave Ron $6$ gold coins. 

He gave Polly $3$ fewer coins than he gave Ron.

**How many coins did Polly get?**
